elements.2211.03151_896725405c8c262de851a4f159ea3: 3D hand pose estimation from RGB images suffers from the difficulty of obtaining the depth information
elements.2211.03151_7fa87be325f8b7154736f8227b8a6: Therefore, a great deal of attention has been spent on estimating 3D hand pose from 2D hand joints
elements.2211.03151_599a4e95c6fbe4a599af02b1080f5: In this paper, we leverage the advantage of spatial-temporal Graph Convolutional Neural Networks and propose LG-Hand, a powerful method for 3D hand pose estimation
elements.2211.03151_a358ed4f9cd876882243776068c72: Our method incorporates both spatial and temporal dependencies into a single process
elements.2211.03151_4e80e553d7194032ec0f786658ee0: We argue that kinematic information plays an important role, contributing to the performance of 3D hand pose estimation
elements.2211.03151_6300841ed6ab3d04fa63e4afcbda5: We thereby introduce two new objective functions, Angle and Direction loss, to take the hand structure into account
elements.2211.03151_4c86bc6aad7415c4c26b0c368ca13: While Angle loss covers locally kinematic information, Direction loss handles globally kinematic one
elements.2211.03151_f7e79b6b7f27f5eb7bfc42ab4daae: Our LG-Hand achieves promising results on the First-Person Hand Action Benchmark (FPHAB) dataset
elements.2211.03151_6af414070238dc8e08f664d8c9e10: We also perform an ablation study to show the efficacy of the two proposed objective functions.
elements.2211.03151_f1fb3e96c54b5382796936d2d5fbf: hand pose estimation, kinematic knowledge, spatial-temporal graph, local and global constraints
elements.2211.03151_f0009347207d9343ee702c47e90a7: Hand is one of vital parts of human, serving a wide range of actions such as holding, writing, or handshaking
elements.2211.03151_b5d84b54cda536e5f8f6c793f4392: Hand pose estimation, an interesting task of computer vision, thereby plays a critical role in real-world applications
elements.2211.03151_efdaef2a81bf36b551b2a7698480e: These applications include robotics, human-machine interaction, and entertainment
elements.2211.03151_0914142c412cde3cf57f3824c20ce: When it comes from 2D to 3D prediction, both hand and human pose estimation suffer from depth ambiguity
elements.2211.03151_70e83ad947707d97f0c74da3269d2: The hand, a deformable object with a high degree of freedom, is also prune to be occluded as it interacts with the world, so 3D hand pose estimation still remains challenging
elements.2211.03151_46ceaab17b63027127edaaa19f402: Most of existing methods try to solve 3D hand pose estimation by firstly localizing joints in a 2D space, then lifting 3D joints from estimated 2D joints
elements.2211.03151_fd62de0952d20c585c44693d60d22: The depth information can be used for 3D hand joints prediction, as shown in
elements.2211.03151_c080efbe9b7bb84fff9353ed24621: utilize the depth image to project 3D points onto three orthogonal planes and then regresses multi-view 2D heatmaps
elements.2211.03151_f327edafc8a21ca47af4f52d62c85: These heatmaps are finally fused together to estimate 3D hand joint coordinates
elements.2211.03151_1c4edf3c53535ec12d2bdd4e28fb5: However, the depth information is limited in outdoor scenarios and even hard to obtain
elements.2211.03151_32a23c4c074b35583dc7f1bb3fac0: Therefore, many efforts have been paid to estimate 3D hand pose from a single RGB image, as proposed in
elements.2211.03151_70c1c42eee9265239b34fb3a0feb9: These three methods use off-the-shelf techniques for 2D hand pose estimation and then build 3D estimators to predict 3D hand joints without using the depth information
elements.2211.03151_e036229950bc32ec671c749c60f27: use non-linear least-squares minimization to fit a 3D hand model to the estimated 2D joints, HOPE-Net
elements.2211.03151_85746682ee5e08a0a0af158190165: take the advantage of Graph Convolutional Neural Networks to reconstruct 3D hand joints from 2D coordinates
elements.2211.03151_fbc2bae8c6f0c53eba82e433d5486: Instead of using a spatial graph as in
elements.2211.03151_98f48a57417463e523a5e37a07503: propose exploiting spatial-temporal Graph Convolutional Neural Networks to alleviate the issue of depth ambiguity
elements.2211.03151_1a591a9d6342ce9e00c92a4bdc17e: However, geometric constraints of hand structure (bone length for example) are not taken into account
elements.2211.03151_75db705818d58fb1558e5db4871dc: introduces a new partial loss function, the consistency of the finger bone length, to better estimate 3D hand joints.
elements.2211.03151_14c3fda5f9ca272e97252b93ab770: We argue that the consistency of the finger bone length is not enough for supporting 3D hand pose estimation
elements.2211.03151_cf7921c4cba4b6b9f64915e40d0fe: For example, when the ground-truth and predicted finger have the same bone length, we are still not sure that the predicted finger matches the ground-truth one
elements.2211.03151_a20b0a11c748da7c5c85cfbd5e255: The predicted finger might also look weird, as illustrated by the yellow finger in Fig.
elements.2211.03151_e8ca708f404a41b035b977408eb09: Motivated by this observation, we propose LG-Hand, a method based on spatial-temporal Graph Convolutional Neural Networks, for 3D hand pose estimation
elements.2211.03151_b3ba2f0e8d9bc399a49b07f9a5b2f: We introduce locally and globally kinematic constraints to make the predicted 3D hand joints more accurate
elements.2211.03151_1e10bb586eb1ee25ce60056f0634d: Concretely, we encourage the model to learn the angle of the knuckles within a finger, which could be referred to as local information
elements.2211.03151_276b07af00ed1016da232542c6652: However, two fingers can still be different even if they have the same angles of the knuckles, as depicted by the red finger in Fig.
elements.2211.03151_c0ec9850f4707d9ce4b71a5980b33: To solve this issue, we thereby add the constraints of the direction of the knuckles, which could be regarded as global information
elements.2211.03151_bc1ae30f603d2327874c0696e32a8: Our key contributions are summarized as follows:
elements.2211.03151_55d5b037f77811e6a825298fa7963: We propose LG-Hand, an end-to-end framework to estimate 3D hand joints from 2D hand joints.
elements.2211.03151_002502103640f1d12b2e2fcf72b9c: We introduce new objective functions to model locally and globally kinematic constraints.
elements.2211.03151_65f132203b718d07f36af09e2b9c2: We obtain promising results on FPHAB dataset, including the average MPJPE of 17.25 (mm).
elements.2211.03151_0781be0339954f8f5e293d262e414: 3D hand joints prediction could be obtained by using magnetic sensors or single RGB images
elements.2211.03151_ee69c761b8e19661dd2c3954e3a9a: This section presents the methods for 3D hand pose estimation using RGB images
elements.2211.03151_2c60f96da62297f128ddb628ecf36: Especially, Graph Convolutional Neural (GCN) Networks are also reviewed because they directly relate to our method.
elements.2211.03151_ac352f3851f1b294f95bde984a930: utilized off-the-shell 2D pose estimators to generate 2D joints and then introduced Adaptive Graph U-Net architecture to match the hand from 2D to 3D space
elements.2211.03151_897c47ef8aefdf5e5ef3e230a1f7d: Liuhao et al. developed a GCN-based method to generate 3D hand mesh from a single RGB image
elements.2211.03151_1611a8a01847d27e11b16d91ecc8a: A dataset with 3D annotations was created to train the model in a suppervised manner
elements.2211.03151_6d0152b662fc373d91c405e1c94cd: The model was then fine-tuned on real-world datasets without 3D annotations
elements.2211.03151_a2517b332e3f301c1071f122ee7c1: Especially, 3D depth maps were generated from rendered 3D meshes to monitor the training process.
elements.2211.03151_cf3998ca2a283820e6d8611c4be73: directly obtained 3D hand joints from 2D coordinates by using conventional components such as linear layers, batch normalization, dropout, and Relu activations
elements.2211.03151_8048fe3bfa099f0de12e1a0948a02: On the other hand, Christian and Thomas
elements.2211.03151_76f0c2ef11530669788c80ab9bb0c: first generated score maps with respect to hand joint locations
elements.2211.03151_b8ddbe9aee5335e575858017e6a06: They then used a PosePrior network to predict 3D hand joint coordinates.
elements.2211.03151_90af4d5873c21b5b9afef8d1ad357: While conventional convolutions only handle the grid-based data such as images, there are various types of data in reality
elements.2211.03151_1bb1e7d08586c1d75c9716cf2eb81: These types of data include social data or user interaction
elements.2211.03151_613feb5e350091be20393c8510487: Conventional convolutions showed the limitation in addressing non-grid data
elements.2211.03151_88b8ad0a112d1788496160be4e265: Therefore, GCN Networks were proposed to deal with this problem
elements.2211.03151_4cb8687d5cafa471eb57736adeb34: We also utilize GCN Networks in our method, which will be presented in Section
elements.2211.03151_0ff8c7383c84364eafd5bc588f341: This section first presents the overall framework of LG-Hand especially the procedue of constructing an input hand sequence
elements.2211.03151_54a5e1160c9f7449dba6ac5571e17: Next, we present Graph Convolutional Neural (GCN) Networks to process input hand sequences
elements.2211.03151_fdd06383d70ce78ef9e090fc60072: We then describe the local-to-global network, one of important parts of our method for multi-scale training
elements.2211.03151_1670a27bec4b9ff5b8faeccb4742d: Finally, the objective function, including our locally and globally kinematic constraints, will be shown in detail
elements.2211.03151_add06de41bb7b4b3457fd0142fac0: Note that we call the method, proposed by Yujun et al.
elements.2211.03151_f3352a8538c6c11f1a2b5abce0ff5: The overall framework of LG-Hand is illustrated in Fig.
elements.2211.03151_cf7682f41f3e2b44d2f3241dba210: LG-Hand takes as input a sequence of 2D hand skeletons of consecutive frames and outputs the 3D hand joints of the target frame
elements.2211.03151_4df41f1524d3d1e7ec2f50653fbdd: Concretely, the predicted 2D hand joints of consecutive frames (...,
elements.2211.03151_c13e723b4c23f586761073b0626c8: , ...) are combined into a spatial-temporal graph and then fed into a GCN-based local-to-global network, which is described in Fig.
elements.2211.03151_0ea515f567b381322dd56c894b113: , to produce 3D hand joints of the frame
elements.2211.03151_1685c5ece26d9399c964f7cb0a9c0: At the end of the pipeline, we propose two new objective functions, called Angle and Direction loss, to leverage kinematic characteristics
elements.2211.03151_72dfbf61ff24cabfe12384ee976c2: The GCN-based local-to-global network and the objective function will be elaborated in Section
elements.2211.03151_9a32f63b9adffd7d7f1a08a96cd81: The remainder of this section presents the way to construct the spatial-temporal graph from the sequence of 2D hand skeletons.
elements.2211.03151_4a9c2a9702765433f41ca7a50363d: From a sequence of skeletons with
elements.2211.03151_cea92736e766feee4095868c66dce: frames, we construct an undirected spatial-temporal graph

elements.2211.03151_12a5504593ca6ad22b44e70f80605: , we first connect the joints of one frame following the natural connections of the human hand
elements.2211.03151_32fa3f5113d3a65ebca1924683edd: Next, the joints of the same type are connected between the consecutive frames
elements.2211.03151_c7d8c19618f58e21fced119bf888d: By doing so, our method can work with an arbitraty amount of joints

elements.2211.03151_72795d125d4e475c11f85705e6327: Graph Convolutional Neural Networks for 3D hand pose estimation
elements.2211.03151_2c8c744f602c59d3d9d9e355f715b: For Graph Convolutional Neural (GCN) Networks, Kipf and Welling
elements.2211.03151_fb55d9afc7a7a002cfd53f145fddd: is the matrix of filter parameters with
elements.2211.03151_d3f39b3d763ebe6079e15025e5b2b: are the normalized versions of the adjacency matrix and degree matrix respectively (
elements.2211.03151_1d92c1eb458418699a9fc71445c26: ) can be extended for hand pose estimation
elements.2211.03151_4c142e86dccab951fd1b546d93eac: First, the neighboring nodes are divided into five groups according to their position relative to the central node, as illustrated in Fig.
elements.2211.03151_392aedda8e7bb6cd3d1048c9bb71b: These five groups include a central node (green), a time-forward node (orange), a time-backward node (purple), physically-connected nodes containing the one closer (yellow) to and the one further (blue) from the skeleton root (red)
elements.2211.03151_19851a52b6d16eb35bde9e7991b36: GCN Networks are thereby extended to:
elements.2211.03151_bb8077ee3523bc15070c0fd0d0902: is the index of the neighbor types, and
elements.2211.03151_e672a5b01b82bc3e2bc887b328d89: is the filter matrix for the
elements.2211.03151_8f05bd1f9469bb5121b6978a984ec: GCN-based local-to-global network plays an important role in our method, being responsible for processing and combining the features at different scales, as described in Fig.
elements.2211.03151_8ddb137e60c90d914ef2f1668a81e: The pipeline can be split into two stages: bottom-up and top-down
elements.2211.03151_c278e24ea622d927e43f0fe254aab: At the bottom-up stage, the network takes as input the spatial-temporal graph and uses graph convolutional and graph pooling layers to extract the features
elements.2211.03151_44550484a409a1b0a389b94d57b15: The later top-down stage conducts upsampling and combining the upsampled features with the high-resolution ones from the bottom layers
elements.2211.03151_d43db9d88d4ef6b083d36f96e4fbc: To effectively remain the information learned in the bottom-up stage, an element-wise concatenation is applied for the same-scale features of the bottom-up and top-down stage
elements.2211.03151_a1b6a3cb1422f37f00f5e0bc95102: Finally, a non-local block is used before generating 3D hand pose sequences to support the full hand reconstruction.
elements.2211.03151_cb1366b90c92656d74b2ec707c6b2: One of the important parts of GCN-based local-to-global network is graph pooling and upsampling, as illustrated in Fig.
elements.2211.03151_dd9bfa27d12e12eeccbb8982e48ce: The 21 hand joints are first split into groups according to the palm and the fingers
elements.2211.03151_205fa4d2cb0ca34fccbe05efa35b6: A max pooling operation is then applied to each group, resulting in a smaller graph with 6 nodes, where each node represents the local information of a region of the hand
elements.2211.03151_24d1c3f0fcdec0068aa2b3107717b: An extra max pooling operation is applied to the 6-node graph, leading to a 1-node graph
elements.2211.03151_d299aa0e47b34e2d1039a9a305f52: This 1-node graph contains the global information of the hand
elements.2211.03151_7f71ef1d3a037722f29a5e3b3a631: In contrast, upsampling operation is responsible for converting a sparse graph to a full graph, as described in Fig.
elements.2211.03151_87ebc6983e08ce6fc0f6376d9dddf: both utilize spatial-temporal Graph Convolutional Neural Networks for 3D hand pose estimation, but their predictions might produce weird fingers, as illustrated in Fig.
elements.2211.03151_7c988dd69ca9e9bef24f5c62b727f: The fingers might violate the naturally kinematic characteristics of the hand
elements.2211.03151_0d03050f353052c309fbeb6cc4e60: Inspired by this issue, we propose two new objective functions, being Angle and Direction loss, to remain the kinematic characteristics of the predicted hand
elements.2211.03151_f36931a10f74ac1ccda77dad0890a: knuckles of the ground-truth hand of the

elements.2211.03151_99f1682821329577758b1a81f4d18: We elaborate the effect of our Angle and Direction loss by measuring MPJPE across different parts of the hand, as illustrated in Fig.
elements.2211.03151_d1aaaa43728f0c0beef6aa998624b: For each method, MPJPEs across the fingers are similar while MPJPEs across the types of joints have a larger gap
elements.2211.03151_9c002783fcd5da6360d05dccebaed: This observation is understandable because the fingers play the similar roles while the different types of joints have different connections
elements.2211.03151_5e8220ec9a3954d6b5ddd0e6e8cf0: For example, wrist connects to 5 MCP-joints of 5 fingers while PIP-joint connects to MCP-joint and DIP-joint on each finger
elements.2211.03151_f5f16fc8ed66436767c3c677fe5ac: Especially, the results show that LG-Hand significantly reduces MPJPE of all parts of the hand compared to ST-GCN and SST-GCN.
elements.2211.03151_437ec0f175636c48493564944e135: In the sequence of predicted 3D hand joints for the
elements.2211.03151_298572c8b2bc47818795ed6ca2753: pour wine" action, we take the
elements.2211.03151_14f0a544c3af1e51b0b9b1a79b24e: -th frame for visualization in 3D space, as described in Fig.
elements.2211.03151_d772bbf9b17fa2dff45960b3e32f7: The results of ST-GCN and SST-GCN show weird predictions such as the ring finger and the pinky finger
elements.2211.03151_c7d644b88099d5540552aeeb85a00: These fingers violate the kinematic characteristics of the hand.
elements.2211.03151_11dc501e14ffbd81018786fac3813: By using Angle and Direction loss, LG-Hand is able to produce the better results, where no weird prediction appears.
elements.2211.03151_3995e0c776f0f924426ba919aa85c: We also display MPJPE, Angle loss, and Direction loss of the methods as in Fig.
elements.2211.03151_c18ef899a9556cfa1f4a7d2497b9d: LG-Hand obtains the smallest error compared to both ST-GCN and SST-GCN.
elements.2211.03151_35595865556ff156179ad358d0cb1: We also examine the tendency of MPJPE, Angle loss, and Direction loss along the sequence of the
elements.2211.03151_372684465ae10ada1d080de0d4449: squeeze paper" action, as illustrated in Fig.
elements.2211.03151_0dadf4beab70ad5b4a63543363f28: Compared to ST-GCN and SST-GCN, our LG-Hand has the smaller values of the losses, and our losses tend to strongly decrease along the sequence.
elements.2211.03151_b6ec33a13525acd4994e0a9a231a8: We examine the effect of each loss element by varying the loss weights, as shown in Table
elements.2211.03151_c5bdb545a78cd48b676c8a66bb73e: The results are reported on FPHAB dataset with 45 actions
elements.2211.03151_ed065eba1b9583c5a94ab2796fc2b: We first train LG-Hand with using only 3D pose loss, and the result is presented in the first row of Table
elements.2211.03151_b5c8b92f0368345abbc5a12a82ccb: We then gradually add Finger length loss, Angle loss, and Direction loss to see how the model behaves
elements.2211.03151_a01a541ab3e275433bfe83b8704f8: The results show that the model performance is significantly improved by using all four loss functions
elements.2211.03151_1b49a46027a2464ccc6c6a1eda0de: For instance, the best setting, the last row of Table
elements.2211.03151_7ecd4e07dc74e03d74257301be339: , exhibits a MPJPE improvement of 3.00 mm compared to only using 3D pose loss.
elements.2211.03151_a31cf7bf30a14ef7cdd7b84c30181: To elaborate the performance of LG-Hand, we compute the percentage of correct 3D hand poses for various thresholds (measured in millimeters) on FPHAB dataset
elements.2211.03151_c0d05ff7a653fd47c076c69e008e4: A prediction is correct if MPJPE between the ground-truth and predicted 3D hand pose is less than the predefined threshold
elements.2211.03151_6ca25c8546348c1b22e730cfb0638: , LG-Hand outperforms SST-GCN and ST-GCN with all thresholds.
elements.2211.03151_debe2a3361a8744c317e37a7d9490: We examine the behavior of LG-Hand with various amounts of skeleton frames, as shown in Table
elements.2211.03151_35011d9cb72b11dc466e33963f0e8: There is no benefit when increasing the number of skeleton frames
elements.2211.03151_ab5c74a99a97c813c9fc08c04e4a9: Therefore, LG-Hand uses 3 skeleton frames for a computational efficiency.
elements.2211.03151_81661be2668c9fa35ea910270cc1d: In this paper, we propose LG-Hand, a spatial-temporal GCN-based method for 3D hand pose estimation
elements.2211.03151_3c88fe99a90fdd401964ff69ba7bc: We take as input a sequence of consecutive frames of 2D hand joints and output 3D hand joint coordinates
elements.2211.03151_553863800d9c192228e4d79aa0840: We especially introduce Angle and Direction loss, which can be known as local and global constraint respectively, to incorporate the kinematic information of the hand into the overall objective function
elements.2211.03151_87639de577d469ee164ecee5580de: The experimental results show that LG-Hand surpasses the previous methods such as ST-GCN and SST-GCN
elements.2211.03151_a5ee7ed39ea4690402fa4ac82c3cd: For future work, we are interested in researching more objective functions related to the kinematic constraints of the hand to further improve the performance of 3D hand pose estimation.
